metadata.title: CVE-2023-6270 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high
metadata.description: A flaw was found in the ATA over Ethernet (AoE) driver in the Linux kernel.The aoecmd_cfg_pkts() function improperly updates the refcnt on `structnet_device`, and a use-after-free can be triggered by racing between thefree on the struct and the access through the `skbtxq` global queue. Thiscould lead to a denial of service condition or potential code execution.

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
linux-hwe package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
linux-kvm package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
linux-aws package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.

linux-gcp package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
